sect1.title: Libre Office &libreoffice-version;

sect2.title: Installation of Libre Office
sect2.para: Install Libre Office by running the following commands:

screen.userinput: tar -xf ../libreoffice-translations-&libreoffice-version;.tar.xz --strip-components=1 && tar -xf ../libreoffice-help-&libreoffice-version;.tar.xz --strip-components=1 && tar -xf ../libreoffice-dictionaries-&libreoffice-version;.tar.xz --strip-components=1 && ./autogen.sh --prefix=/usr \ --disable-binfilter \ --disable-gconf \ --disable-mozilla \ --disable-odk \ --with-system-boost \ --with-system-cairo \ --with-system-curl \ --with-system-db \ --with-system-expat \ --with-system-hunspell \ --with-system-icu \ --with-system-jpeg \ --with-system-libpng \ --with-system-libxml \ --with-system-neon \ --with-system-nss \ --with-system-openssl \ --with-system-poppler \ --with-system-postgresql \ --with-system-redland \ --with-system-zlib \ --with-num-cpus=$(getconf _NPROCESSORS_ONLN) \ --with-vendor="BLFS" \ --with-lang="pt-BR" \ --without-java && ./download && mkdir -p ../libre-office-downloads && cp -rf src/* ../libre-office-downloads && make

sect2.para: This package does not come with a test suite.
Now, as the root user:

screen.userinput: make install && for program in base calc draw impress math writer do echo "#!/bin/bash exec /usr/lib/libreoffice/program/soffice --${program} \"\${@}\"" > /usr/bin/${program} chmod 755 /usr/bin/${program} done && for res in 16 32 48 128 256 do mkdir -p /usr/share/icons/hicolor/${res}x${res}/{apps,mimetypes} cp sysui/desktop/icons/hicolor/${res}x${res}/apps/*.png \ /usr/share/icons/hicolor/${res}x${res}/apps cp sysui/desktop/icons/hicolor/${res}x${res}/mimetypes/*.png \ /usr/share/icons/hicolor/${res}x${res}/mimetypes done && gtk-update-icon-cache /usr/share/icons/hicolor

sect2.title: Command Explanations
sect2.para: tar -xf ../libreoffice-translations-&libreoffice-version;.tar.xz --strip-components=1: This untars the translations inside the source. The --strip-components=1 option removes the leading directory from the path of the untared files. Without this option we would need to move or symlink the translations folder into the correct position.

tar -xf ../libreoffice-help-&libreoffice-version;.tar.xz --strip-components=1: This untars the help files inside the source. The --strip-components=1 option removes the leading directory from the path of the untared files. Without this option we would need to move or symlink the helpcontent2 folder into the correct position.

tar -xf ../libreoffice-dictionaries-&libreoffice-version;.tar.xz --strip-components=1: This untars the dictionaries inside the source. The --strip-components=1 option removes the leading directory from the path of the untared files. Without this option we would need to move or symlink the dictionaries folder into the correct position.
--enable-gtk3: add this option if you've installed and want to use Gtk+-3.
--disable-binfilter: These "binfilters" enable Libre Office to open legacy Star Office format documents. Compiling binfilter requires Java.
--disable-gconf: Compiling with support for GConf requires the deprecated ORBit.
--disable-mozilla: This option stops Libre Office trying to compile an old version of SeaMonkey.
--disable-odk: This disables installing the office development kit. remove this option if you want to develop a Libre Office based application.
--with-system- ...: These options stops it trying to compile its own versions of these dependencies. If you've not installed some of these dependencies remove the corresponding option.
--with-num-cpus=$(getconf _NPROCESSORS_ONLN): This option tells it to use all your CPUs to compile in parallel and speed up the build.
--with-lang="pt-BR": This option sets what languages to support. en-US is always included by default. For a list of the available options: ls translations/source.
--without-java: This option compiles Libre Office without Java support.
./download: The download script downloads the source to a collection of things that might be needed during the build process.

mkdir -p ../libre-office-downloads; cp -rf src/* ../libre-office-downloads: The download script downloads some 320MB of source tarballs, many of which are not not needed as they are probably already installed on your system. This command makes a backup copy of the downloaded files so you don't have to download them again if you decide to recompile Libre Office. In that case, just start by mkdir src; cp ../libre-office-downloads/* src
for program in base calc draw impress math writer ...: These commands create 6 simple shell scripts in /usr/bin that can be used to launch Libre Office.
for res in 16 32 48 128 256 ...: These commands copy various icons into the hicolor icon theme used by Gtk+.
gtk-update-icon-cache /usr/share/icons/hicolor: This rebuilds /usr/share/icons/hicolor/icon-theme.cache to include the new icons.
